DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient has brain metastases.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to brain metastasis being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Present; the period of time that is happening now.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator relating to disease description.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/12/12-updated max length Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are there more than five brai
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are there more than five brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have brain metastases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Four or fewer brain metastases (as defined on the preoperative MRI brain scan) and status post resection of one of the lesions

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Four or fewer brain metastases (as defined on the preoperative MRI or CT brain scan) and status post resection of one of the lesions

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any new brain metastases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known brain metastases (testing optional)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Metastases to brain stem, midbrain, pons, medulla, cerebellum, or within 10mm of the optic apparatus (optic nerves and chiasm)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has no evidence of new or enlarging brain metastases.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has 5 or more brain metastases as counted on a T1 contrast enhanced MRI obtained less than or equal to 30 days from randomization

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Brain metastasis velocity since upfront SRS must be greater than or equal to 4 brain metastases per year.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiographic confirmation of one to four brain metastases, one of which requires resection, as defined by MRI with contrast.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Brain metastasis velocity since last SRS must be greater than or equal to 4 brain metastases per year.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have at least 1 and up to 8 total intact brain metastasis detected on a contrast-enhanced MRI performed within 21 days prior to registration?
